Dear Bill:
As last year’s resolutions chairman for DAVI, I concur
with your decision to make a drastic change in procedures.
Resolutions are far too important statements to be worked out by
a few people in a short time. Policy statements must be pains¬
takingly worked out by our best people without hurry. There
may be a place for ’’appreciation" type resolutions at a conven¬
tion.
I have enjoyed my association with NAEB and its
wonderful professional staff. The NAEB-DAVI fraternization
pleases me very much. Let me know if I may be of service to you.
